intro: Albuca hysterantha, commonly known as the golden bulb orchid, is a striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its ornamental, bulbous stems and clusters of showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowering period usually occurs in late summer to early autumn, adding a vibrant touch to gardens. Albuca hysterantha is valued for its unique appearance and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes.
